item.title: Xbox President Shares New Details On Next-Gen Xbox Console
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/xbox-president-shares-new-details-on-next-gen-xbox-console/1100-6532502/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Microsoft has announced a "strategic, multiyear" partnership with AMD to power its next-generation devices, including the next Xbox home console.

Xbox president Sarah Bond made the announcement today. She said Microsoft and AMD will work together to "co-engineer silicon across a portfolio of devices, including our next-generation Xbox consoles. In your living room and in your hands."

Working with AMD, Bond said Microsoft will be able to allow for a "deeper level of visual quality" with "immersive gameplay" and "enhanced" with the power of AI.

Microsoft's vision is to create a platform that allows games to be "always with you" across devices. No longer will games to "locked to a single store" or only supported on a single device, Bond said, adding that the Xbox and Windows teams will work closely to achieve this.

In February 2024, Bond said the next Xbox would offer the "largest technical leap you will have ever seen in a hardware generation."

As for Microsoft's handheld ambitions, the company's plans for its own Xbox handheld device are potentially on hold or canceled. However, the company is working with Asus on multiple Xbox ROG Ally devices that are set to launch this holiday, but there is no word on pricing as of yet. The systems can play all types of games, including PlayStation PC titles.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Remedy Continues Weird Puppet Show Idea With FBC: Firebreak Trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/remedy-continues-weird-puppet-show-idea-with-fbc-firebreak-trailer/1100-6532499/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Remember the creepy children's puppet show from Control? FBC: Firebreak's launch trailer isn't nearly as creepy, but it's continuing the puppet show idea that Control started, at least.

Remedy's launch trailer for their first multiplayer game doesn't feature gameplay of any type. Instead, it leans into the narrative element of the entire Remedy universe.

We're less than a day into FBC: Firebreak's lifespan and the three-player cooperative shooter already has a mostly negative rating from players on Steam. Many reviews have less than an hour of playtime, meaning they either didn't spend much time in the game, they bounced off of the gameplay quickly, or some combination of both. Other reviews give positive feedback while calling other reviews disingenuous. In GameSpot's FBC: Firebreak preview, Mark Delaney called the FPS "a defiant, punk rock take on co-op shooters."

FBC: Firebreak is the first multiplayer game from the studio behind Control and Alan Wake. It features teams of three--each person has their own distinct kit--taking on hordes of enemies while trying to accomplish a variety of objectives. There are three jobs available at launch, each with a number of difficulty settings that expand the length of the job and number of enemies.

Many reviews cite a lack of content as a reason for their disappointment. Remedy has detailed two future updates, including additional jobs and maps that will come to the game this Fall and Winter. Fans looking for more from FBC: Firebreak could check back in after those updates are released.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Bruno Mars Is Your Next Fortnite Festival Headliner
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/bruno-mars-is-your-next-fortnite-festival-headliner/1100-6532488/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After everyone spent the last couple weeks believing the headlining artist for Fortnite Festival Season 9 would be Deadmau5, the reality ended up being something completely different: Bruno Mars will be the actual new Festival Icon when Season 9 launches on Wednesday.

Bruno Mars is an interesting choice because he's already in Fortnite. The Silk Sonic set, which included skins for both Bruno Mars and Anderson .Paak, was released way back in 2022. None of the eight previous Festival season headliners had been added to the game as skins prior to their respective seasons.

The new Fortnite Festival Season will come with a new Music Pass, which will be available for 1400 V-Bucks or via Fortnite Crew. The highlight is the Die With a Smile Bruno skin, which is based on the singer's look in the video for his and Lady Gaga's track Die With a Smile. That skin unlocks instantly when you purchase the pass, and you can gain XP across any Fortnite experience to progress the pass from there. Also included with the paid pass is a guitar, a drum kit, and jam tracks for Bruno-San's Theme Song, Silk Sonic's Leave the Door Open, ABC by tThe Jackson 5, and Mun Ra by Sabotage. There are free rewards as well for those who don't buy the pass, including instruments, auras, and four jam tracks.

Naturally, Bruno Mars will also have a set of cosmetics in the shop throughout the season, starting with the Bruno-San skin, which has two distinctive styles. Alongside the skin will be a back bling, a contrail, a keytar, a bass, and both an emote and jam track for his song Bonde do Brunão--all of these will be included in one big bundle. Outside the bundle, the shop will also have jam tracks for Die With a Smile by Bruno Mars and Lady Gaga, and APT by Rose and Bruno Mars.

For longtime Fortnite players, this update will also come with a feature that's been heavily requested for years and years: If you set your lobby music to random, it will actually play a different song when the one you're listening to finishes. Since lobby music was first introduced to Fortnite in Chapter 1 Season 6--that was seven years ago!--the random feature would simply pick one song and play it on a loop until you left the lobby.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: GTA 5's Latest Major Update Is Live With A Money-Laundering Theme
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gta-5s-latest-major-update-is-live-with-a-money-laundering-theme/1100-6532494/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

While GTA 6 is delayed, Rockstar Games continues to expand the events and features found in GTA Online. The new Money Fronts expansion is live, which lets players take control of a massive money-laundering operation.

GTA Online offers players several ways to increase their income, and the latest revenue stream comes from working for the head of San Andreas' biggest money-laundering network. In Money Fronts, players start out by taking over the Hands On Car Wash in Strawberry to clean some dirty money. Purchasing the Hands On Car Wash will then unlock the ability to purchase two other money laundering locations: Smoke on the Water dispensary and Higgins Helitours.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: GTA 6 (Grand Theft Auto VI) - Official Release Date Reveal | Trailer 2

Owning these new business fronts allows access to unique Money-Laundering missions. Earnings from these laundering operations are stored inside the player's duffle bag found in the car wash bedroom. To celebrate the launch of Money Fronts, Rockstar says that missions launched from the Hands On Car Wash will pay out 2X GTA$ and RP this week.

Getting into the laundering business also benefits other operations in GTA Online. Owning the car wash boosts all Counterfeit Cash Factory sales from a player's MC business, while owning the dispensary provides a bump to all Weed Farm sales. Additionally, Operating Higgins Helitours as a front results in a lift for all Air Freight Cargo.

While money laundering is great for building a cash empire, there are some risks that come with cleaning all that dirty money. Money-Laundering missions raise suspicion from the authorities in the form of Heat on the various business fronts. Businesses with Heat will be flagged with caution signals on the map, and it requires players to cool things back down by completing legal activity. This means activities such as cleaning customer cars at the car wash and delivering legal weed for the dispensary.

Mr. Faber, the head of the money-laundering network, also gives unique missions for additional extra cash and RP rewards. These Mr. Faber Work missions include various tasks, such as recovering stolen assets, escorting valuable cargo, and dealing with rival outfits. These raise the Heat level on a player's money-laundering businesses, and more of the legal activities will need to be completed to reduce this.

Additionally, the Money Fronts expansion includes six new vehicles for purchase, including the Överflöd Suzume supercar. This supercar is available early to GTA+ Members through June 25 and free for members to claim at The Vinewood Car Club until July 16.

Rockstar teases even more content planned for GTA Online. The developer says in an announcement post that there's "plenty more coming to GTA Online in the weeks and months ahead, including six more vehicles arriving next week, a new gig as a transporter of high-value goods, and more."

As for GTA 6, the game is now set for release in May 2026.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: PlayStation: The Concert Is Coming To North America This Year
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/playstation-the-concert-is-coming-to-north-america-this-year/1100-6532492/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

PlayStation: The Concert will bring music from popular Sony franchises to cities across the United States and Canada starting in October 2025 and running through April 2026. Pre-sale for tickets begins on June 18 at 7 AM PT / 10 AM ET.

"This is Coachella for game music," said PlayStation: The Concert composer Chad Cannon in a video preview of the event.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: The Status of Every PlayStation Franchise

The interactive performance will feature four chapters that focus on the music from The Last of Us, God of War, Ghost of Tsushima, and Horizon: Zero Dawn. The concert will also feature music from Bloodborne, Uncharted, Astrobot, Helldivers 2, and Journey.

"Through breathtaking performances of gaming’s most celebrated music and state-of-the-art visual technology, each segment transforms your favorite games’ worlds into a fully immersive experience," reads the official PlayStation website. "PlayStation | The Concert is more than a show: it’s the ultimate celebration of gaming’s music, culture and innovation."

The tour will begin on October 9, 2025 at the Community Arts Center in Williamsport, Pennsylvania. It'll come to an end on April 13, 2026 in Montreal, Quebec. Fans looking to get a sneak peek can listen to parts of the featured soundtracks on Spotify ahead of the tour dates. More tour locations and dates could be announced in the future, according to PlayStation.

This concert is a collaboration between the studios behind these games, PlayStation, and award-winning arrangers and composers like Gustavo Santaolalla, Bear McCreary, Ilan Eshkeri, and Joris de Man. These artists are the award-winning minds behind the scores of movies like Brokeback Mountain and 47 Ronin.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
